{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3480137,"name":"","username":"ruskcoder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T18:49:57.285Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone! I am currently working on a climb prototype, using a shaft. My question is: Is there anything such as a “backstop clutch” or “ratchet” that can be attached/mounted at the end of the shaft to prevent it from going one way and ratcheting in the other? And, presumably, we can use a servo to switch the direction of the ratchet.
Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T18:49:57.285Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":84,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":468.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481228,"topic_slug":"backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70129,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3480145,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T18:55:10.254Z","cooked":"
andymark.com

1/2 in. Hex Ratchet Plate

A simple ratchet like this is a straightforward way to tension strings, such as those in an elevator mechanism, or prevent backdrive of a mechanism that always needs to spin in the same direction. This Ratchet Plate is easy to attach on either a 2...

Other common approaches from other vendors (integrated into gearboxes and not - referring to your servo question).

Finally some teams cannibalize a ratcheting box wrench to interfaces with the 1/2 inch shaft.

Obviously be mindful of going the wrong way with a motor against the ratchet,

Hex Ratchet Plate - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":60}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480153,"name":"Nicholas ","username":"unident","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T19:01:04.014Z","cooked":"

I’m unsure if an electronically reversing ratchet mechanism exists, at least in an FRC context, but there have been a couple switchable one-way ratchet mechanisms designed. for example: MAXPlanetary Locking System

Otherwise, to engage/disengage a ratchet mechanism, an easy way is to use a flex head ratcheting box end wrench - for example, this one from Tekton. the trick is to constrain the handle from rotating side/side, but let it be able to flip out when you would like to disengage or backspin the mechanism. i believe the 2020 EveryBot used this mechanism on its climber.

Alternatively, if you design your climb in a way so that your gearing is high enough to create a large amount of backspin (and subsequently electrical current) on the motor when it loses power, the motor in stall will provide enough resistance to stay hanging for a decent period after the match ends. i don’t believe I’ve seen any calculators for such a thing though.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T19:01:04.014Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":74.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481228,"topic_slug":"backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts","display_username":"Nicholas ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/maxplanetary-locking-system/466537","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXPlanetary Locking System","clicks":44},{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/TEKTON-WRN57010-Flex-Head-Ratcheting-Combination/dp/B01F511X5E/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"TEKTON 1/2 Inch Flex Ratcheting Combination Wrench | WRN57010 - Amazon.com","clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480215,"name":"","username":"ruskcoder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T19:40:10.565Z","cooked":"

I don’t understand how the wrench would flip out. Wouldn’t it be impossible to flip because it would hit the shaft before fully rotating?

here’s a screenshot from the 2017 Ri3D reveal video:

image1189×658 54.2 KB

basically, to let the mechanism reverse after the match, you flex the handle out of the bolts constraining it, and let it freely rotate (carefully). there are probably better examples out there, this is the first one I had remembered.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T19:45:34.914Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":62.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481228,"topic_slug":"backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts","display_username":"Nicholas ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6_UBzGQM-A","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70129,"username":"ruskcoder","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480247,"name":"","username":"ruskcoder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T20:02:44.255Z","cooked":"

Ohhh, that makes more sense, I thought you meant flipping the actual ratchet out. But, I want to be able to disengage and engage during the match, (the arm has to be able to come down initially, then engage, then it should not be able to back down while pulling up). This is definitely doable using this mechanism, but is quite clunky and may have stability issues during the match if the outward rotation is motor powered.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T20:02:44.255Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":40.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481228,"topic_slug":"backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55833,"username":"unident","name":"Nicholas ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70129,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480266,"name":"Nicholas ","username":"unident","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T20:21:00.847Z","cooked":"

Sorry, but I’m having a hard time envisioning the mechanism. Although just based on your need to have the mechanism not backspin in either direction during the match, I would say you have some main options: either throw more power at it (another motor, or higher gearing), re-consider the mechanism design, or most creatively, invent/design a custom mechanism which is able to engage/disengage different ratchet pawls. I could see potentially mirroring the MAXPlanetary ratchet.

Can you get away with adding ~40-80lbs of gas springs on a multi inch lever arm? Using a gearbox with lower efficiency? Some other thing to increase drag?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T20:54:34.672Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481228,"topic_slug":"backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70129,"username":"ruskcoder","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/backstop-bearing-clutch-for-1-2in-hex-shafts/481228/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3480346,"name":"","username":"ruskcoder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ruskcoder/{size}/270717_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T21:19:12.348Z","cooked":"

Well, yes, we could be increasing drag, but that adds some level of complexity (we want the simplest design possible) while also not being 100% fool proof. Though, that might have to be a last ditch effort.

You build one fairly simply using the WCP Ratchet & Paw. You can spring load the paw to stay engaged, and then disengage it with a servo.

WestCoast Products

Friction Brake & Ratchet

The Friction Brake allows you to aid your PID controller in holding an arm, elevator or another subsystem in place or even completely hold your mechanism in place without any motor power! Easy integration with your design Same 1.875" bolt pattern as...

Price: USD 34.99

While it doesn’t switch the direction of the ratchet via the servo, the Ratchet Sport can set the ratchet to engage or disengage via a servo.
